at.geyerritter.dezsys07.rest

Class DataRecordViewController

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.geyerritter.dezsys07.rest.DataRecordViewController

  • @Controller
public class DataRecordViewController
extends Object
    This controller handles HTTP GET requests of the browser (with accept text/html header).
    Therefore the created thymeleaf templates are filled with data of the REST controller and then returned as a HTML document. In order to access the REST controller, an attribute is injected via the @Autowired annotation.

    Unfortunately, there is a bug in IntelliJ IDEA so context variables do not get resolved in thymeleaf templates
    It will be fixed in version 15.1 (release on March 1st, 2016)
    For more info visit https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-132738
    As a workaround you have to add all attributes again in a new WebContext (see if statements in the methods of this class)
    Version:
    20151217.1
    Author:
    Stefan Geyer, Mathias Ritter

    • Method Detail

      • redirectToDisplayDataRecords

        @RequestMapping(value="/",
                method=GET,
                produces="text/html")
public String redirectToDisplayDataRecords()
        Handles browser GET request (with accept text/html header) to the path "/".
        The user gets redirected to the url "/datarecords"
        Returns:
        redirect to "/datarecords"

      • displayDataRecords

        @RequestMapping(value="/datarecords",
                method=GET,
                produces="text/html")
public String displayDataRecords(@RequestParam(value="name",defaultValue="")
                                                                                                                                            String name,
                                                                                                                                            org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Handles browser GET request (with accept text/html header) to the path "/datarecords".
        This page is used to show data records in a table. Therefore data records are retrieved and additionally filtered by the given get parameter name. They are added as an attribute to the model, so they can be accessed by the thymeleaf templates.
        The rendered "overview" template is returned by returning a string with the file name.
        Parameters:
        name - GET parameter name to filter the results
        model - model that is used by the templates
        Returns:
        string with the filename of the template (gets rendered through the framework)

      • displayCreateDataRecords

        @RequestMapping(value="/datarecords/create",
                method=GET,
                produces="text/html")
public String displayCreateDataRecords()
        Handles browser GET request (with accept text/html header) to the path "/datarecords/create".
        This page is used to show a form in order to create a new data record.
        The rendered "create" template is returned by returning a string with the file name.
        Returns:
        string with the filename of the template (gets rendered through the framework)

      • displayDataRecord

        @RequestMapping(value="/datarecords/{id}",
                method=GET,
                produces="text/html")
public String displayDataRecord(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                String id,
                                                                                                                                                org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Handles browser GET request (with accept text/html header) to the path "/datarecords/{id}".
        This page is used to show a specific data record so it can be edited. Therefore the data record with the id given in the URL is retrieved. It is then added as an attribute to the model so it can be accessed by the thymeleaf templates.
        The rendered "edit" template is returned by returning a string with the file name.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the data record that will be shown.
        model - model that is used by the templates
        Returns:
        string with the filename of the template (gets rendered through the framework)

      • handleNotFound

        @ExceptionHandler(value=org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException.class)
 @ResponseStatus(value=NOT_FOUND)
public String handleNotFound(Exception ex)
        This method is used to handle an EmptyResultDataAccessException. This Exception is thrown if an data record can not be found in the database, so a 404 page is returned to the user.
        Parameters:
        ex - Exception that should be handled
        Returns:
        404 not found page
